alert.note: Alert for McDonald; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 24 at 6:49AM CDT until September 25 at 2:48PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall last night is expected to continue. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, McDonald and Newton. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 648 AM CDT, Between 2 and 3 inches of rain has fallen last night. Flooding near streams and low lying areas will likely continue today. - This includes the following low water crossings... Center Creek at Azalea Drive, Buffalo Creek at Klondike Road, Elkhorn Creek at Highway CC, North Indian Creek at Orchid Drive, Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road, Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road and Butler Creek at Kings Highway. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Joplin, Neosho, Pineville, Seneca, Granby, Anderson, Noel, Duquesne, Goodman, South West City, Diamond, Leawood, Silver Creek, Lanagan, Fairview, Shoal Creek Drive, Saginaw, Dodge, Loma Linda, Newtonia, Stella, Redings Mill, Wentworth, Cayuga, Stark City, Grand Falls Plaza, Shoal Creek Estates, Ritchey, Dennis Acres, Cliff Village, Racine, Powell, Rocky Comfort and Big Sugar Creek State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
